text: I think for us it's always been about
building a company that is here to stay
that is here for the next 100 for the
next 10 20 50 years this was Yan Kuhn
the co-founder of whatsapp at a tech
conference on January 20th though kun
never intended to sell his company
a month later Facebook bought it for Li
16 billion dollars
Yan Combe and Brian Acton created
whatsapp in 2009
today it has 450 million users around
the world kun grew up in Kiev Ukraine
until he was 16 when he moved to
Mountain View California he dropped out
of San Jose State University to devote
his time to his job at Yahoo where his
whatsapp co-founder Brian Acton was
already a software engineer in 2007 both
Combe and act and quit their jobs at
Yahoo later they both applied to work at
Facebook and both were rejected Combe
came up with the idea for whatsapp which
has a business strategy that's very
different from Facebook's you can see it
here on this sign written by Brian Acton
that's posted on Coons desk what's app
is free for users for the first year and
then it's $1 a year after that it has no
advertising and it doesn't collect users
personal data Coombes childhood in kiev
explains why he believes in privacy for
whatsapp users I grew up in a country
where I remember my parents not being
able to have a conversation on the phone
my mom would often say this is not a
phone conversation I'll tell you in
person the the walls had ears and you
couldn't speak freely on February 9th
Mark Zuckerberg asked yang kun to dinner
at his home to propose the deal
soon after kun caved facebook's offer
and also to its social network a few
hours after the acquisition was
announced he created a personal Facebook
page
